p: Regarding RSV infection, ribavirin-based therapy has been associated with a significant reduction in the progression from URTI to LRTI [ 5]. Ribavirin has been proven effective in hindering the progression from URTI to LRTI (from 45 to 16%) and in reducing mortality (from 70 to 35%) in onco-hematological patients [ 5]. The lack of ribavirin aerosol therapy has increased the risk of mortality in patients with HSCT [ 49]; ribavirin aerosol is the only approved treatment for severe RSV-related LRTI in infants with underlying conditions such as prematurity, cardiopulmonary disease or immunosuppression [ 5]. In patients with myeloma, routine treatment of RSV infection is not recommended [ 13]. Ribavirin therapy is recommended in patients with leukemia and patients with HSCT at high risk of complications [ 5].
